report_title: Industry Report on Inkjet and Toner Replacement Store Franchises
executive_summary: Operators in the Inkjet and Toner Replacement Store Franchises industry sell inkjet and toner replacement cartridges for printers. Operators take delivery of spent cartridges from franchisees and provide them with refilled and refurbished cartridges. Over the five years to 2021, demand for industry products has decreased leading to an annualized decline of 5.7% to $209.1 million.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Operators in the Inkjet and Toner Replacement Store Franchises industry sell inkjet and toner replacement cartridges for printers. Operators take delivery of spent cartridges from franchisees and provide them with refilled and refurbished cartridges. Over the five years to 2021, demand for industry products has decreased leading to an annualized decline of 5.7% to $209.1 million.

Companies are shifting more toward digital platforms and using e-documents for internal and external purposes. Retail stores also provide an option to email customers their receipts instead of printing them. At the same time, increases in the percentage of business conducted online has significantly affected demand for industry products. In 2020, due to the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus), many businesses shifted their operations to online platforms to maintain social distancing and avoid spreading the virus. Over the five years to 2021, the percentage of business conducted online has increased at an annualized rate of 7.4% to 30.8%.

With the decline in demand for industry products and revenue, many operators have shut down their businesses altogether. At the same time, many big players have acquired smaller companies to increase their market presence and product offerings. Over the five years to 2021, the total number of companies has declined at an annualized rate of 5.5% to 361 operators.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Inkjet and Toner Replacement Store Franchises industry revenue is expected to keep decreasing due the increasing shift toward online platforms over the five years to 2026. Demand is expected to increase in 2021 and 2022 as the economy recovers from the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and restrictions are lower than they were in 2020. However, in the second half of the outlook period, as companies invest more in technology, demand for industry products is expected to decrease. Over the five years to 2026, industry revenue is expected to decline at an annualized rate of 1.1% to $197.7 million.

The percentage of business conducted online is expected to keep increasing over the five years to 2026. Increasing internet penetration is also expected to lead to higher competition from e-commerce websites. In response, many operators will likely shift focus toward online divisions and alternative business models for physical stores. To compete effectively, some operators may have to pursue value-added strategies, such as moving into implementation, customization or servicing.

industry_definition: The franchises in this industry sell inkjet and toner replacement cartridges for printers. Franchisors take delivery of spent cartridges from franchisees and provide them with refilled and refurbished cartridges.
key_trends: Companies are shifting more toward digital platforms and using e-documents for internal and external purposes

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Inkejt and Toner replacement store franchises industry profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is expected to be 4.9% of revenue in 2021.
Labor costs have increased over the five years to 2021, since skilled labor and administrators have been in high demand.
The purchase and distribution of stock is central to the function of wholesaling.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent additions to the industry is low.
This is combined with a low concentration of innovation.
Both factors being low suggests that new technology entry is slow and widespread, which limits the threat of disruptive threats hurting leading industry operators.

FAQs.question: What is the capital intensity of the industry?
FAQs.answer: The capital intensity is described as LOW.

FAQs.question: What is the level of technology change in the industry?
FAQs.answer: The level of technology change is described as MEDIUM.

FAQs.question: What is the revenue volatility in the industry?
FAQs.answer: The revenue volatility is described as MEDIUM.

FAQs.question: What is the level of regulation in the industry?
FAQs.answer: The regulation is described as LIGHT and STEADY.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The industry assistance is described as LOW and STEADY.
